result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlos N Bell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Comply-Officer/Person into Custody, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.415(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: with 2 (two) days credit, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
- No firearms, ammunition, body armor or no voting until rights have been restored.
- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
- Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

- No alcohol, no drugs.
- No contact with Michelle R. or within 1000 feet of the residence.

- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs (treatment) deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety.
- Random urine screens.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Carlos N Bell in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Philip Thomas Kovoor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.    

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 28 MONTHS with 2 (two) days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 14 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 14 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.

 Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs (treatment) deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No firearms, ammunition, body armor or no voting until rights have been restored.
- 20 hours of community service.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with Michelle R. or within 1000 feet of the residence:
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution is set at $0 (zero); 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
- If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any court ordered obilgations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  
.
20 day appeal rights given,
Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Carlos N Bell in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Philip Thomas Kovoor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for jury trial. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. For reasons stated on the record, 

-CASE PASSED
-CASE RECALLED
-SAME APPEARANCES

Court ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. For further reasons stated on the record by the parties, No priors of the defendant to count if the defendant testifies on case # 15CF3230.

Defendant Carlos N Bell in court pro-se.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Indigency hearing continued.  Based upon the defendant's prior statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel again at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Thomas E. Harris to represent the defendant; Attorney Thomas E. Harris to be paid at the rate of $60.00 per hour.  The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate of $50.00 per month continues from July 1, 2016.  Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept.  Order signed and filed. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Carlos N Bell in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for final pretrial. For reasons stated on the record, Attorney Michael B Plaisted informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Defendant will retain private counsel. Case is adjourned for status of counsel, Branch 37. Court ordered August 29, 2016 at 9:00 a.m. jury trial vacated.  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Carlos N Bell in court.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant requests a court appointed attorney. Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based on defendant's statements made in court, the Court finds that the defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Attorney Michael Plaisted as counsel for defendant.  Attorney Plaisted accepts the appointment.  Order signed and filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court involved in a Motion Hearing.  Br. 15, Judge Watts has agreed to handle the Indigency Hearing for Br. 21.  Matter transferred forthwith.
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed; copies sent to State and Department of Corrections.

Defendant Carlos N Bell in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer as a Friend of the Court.  Zachary Wittchow for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
After review of employment status of the defendant, it has been determined that the defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Court suspends the proceedings and orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Same Bail.  Indigency hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Carlos N Bell in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Carlos N Bell in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
